#Text=Remarks by President Biden and Vice President Harris in a Briefing to Preview the First Images from the James Webb Space Telescope
#Text=JULY 11 , 2022 • STATEMENTS AND RELEASES
#Text=South Court Auditorium
#Text=Eisenhower Executive Office Building
#Text=6:13 P.M. EDT
#Text=THE VICE PRESIDENT :
#Text=Thank you .
#Text=Thank you .
#Text=Well , good evening , everyone .
#Text=I am very honored to be with you all .
#Text=President Joe Biden and I talk often about our mutual passion for everything you all do .
#Text=This is a very exciting moment to join you for the unveiling of the work that you have been laboring on for decades .
#Text=So , to our President , Joe Biden , thank you for your leadership around all of these issues .
#Text=Our NASA Administrator , Bill Nelson , and the Office of Science and Technology Policy Acting Director , Dr. Alondra Nelson .
#Text=Thank you also to our colleagues from across the White House and NASA and everyone else joining us from home .
#Text=So , yes , as Chair of the National Space Council , I know that today represents an exciting new chapter in the exploration of our universe .
#Text=From the beginning of history , humans have looked up to the night sky with wonder .
#Text=And thanks to dedicated people who have been working for decades in engineering and on scientific marvels , we can look to the sky with new understanding .

#Text=When NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope in 1990 , we were able to see the stars unobstructed by the Earth ’s atmosphere and understand the universe in ways we could have never imagined even a few decades earlier .
#Text=And now we enter a new phase of scientific discovery .
#Text=Building on the legacy of Hubble , the James Webb Space Telescope allows us to see deeper into space than ever before and in stunning clarity .
#Text=It will enhance what we know about the origins of our universe , our solar system , and possibly life itself .
#Text=This was made possible by partnership among nations .
#Text=And it is an example of how the scientific endeavor can build upon the international rules and norms that govern our cooperation in space .
#Text=This telescope is one of humanity ’s great engineering achievements .
#Text=And the images we will see today are a testament to the amazing work done by the thousands of workers across our nation who dedicated years to this project .

#Text=They embarked on this complex endeavor for the benefit of humankind , and in the process , accelerated American innovation , strengthened partnerships with our allies , and will undoubtedly inspire generations to look to the heavens with excitement and ambition .

#Text=With that , it is my great honor to introduce a leader who has always believed in the power of American innovation and international cooperation to achieve the remarkable : our President , the President of the United States , Joe Biden .
#Text=THE PRESIDENT :
#Text=Well , it ’s great to be with you all .
#Text=And I was going to say “ good afternoon , ” but we ’re starting this meeting late because I was engaged in preparing for a trip to the Middle East .
#Text=But today is a historic day .
#Text=And thank you , Vice President Harris , Chair of the National Space Council .
#Text=And thank you , my dear friend and our outstanding NASA Administrator and the guy — the only guy here who ’s been in space , Bill Nelson .
#Text=Bill , you ’re a good friend .
#Text=Thank you very much for what you ’re doing .
#Text=And — and , Dr. Nelson , you ’re doing a great job leading this Office of Science and Technology Policy .
#Text=It really is a matter — it really is amazing .

#Text=Six and a half months ago , a rocket launched from Earth carrying the world ’s newest , most powerful deep - space telescope on a journey one million miles into the cosmos — first of all , that blows my mind : a million miles into the cosmos — along the way unfolding itself , deploying a mirror 21 feet wide , a sunshield the size of a tennis court , and 250,000 tiny shutters , each one smaller than a grain of sand .
#Text=Put together , it ’s a new window into the history of our universe .
#Text=And today , we ’re going to get a glimpse of the first light to shine through that window — light from other worlds , orbiting stars far beyond our own .
#Text=It ’s astounding to me when I read this and saw the — I mean , it really is .
#Text=It ’s — it ’s — anyway , I do n’t want to — I ’ll see what they think when we see this .
#Text=But light where stars were born and from where they die .
#Text=Light from the oldest galaxies .
#Text=The oldest documented light in the history of the universe from over 13 billion — let me say that again : 13 billion years ago .
#Text=It ’s hard to even fathom .
#Text=Tomorrow , when this image is shared with the world , it will be a historic moment for science and technology , for astronomy and space exploration , for America and all of humanity .
#Text=You know , as an international collaboration , this telescope embodies how America leads the world not by the example of our power , but the power of our example .
#Text=A partnership with others , it symbolizes the relentless spirit of American ingenuity .

#Text=And it shows what we can achieve , what more we can discover , not just about distant places , but about our very own planet and climate , like NASA ’s Earth System Observatory that we launched last year .
#Text=That ’s why the federal government must invest — must invest in science and technology , more than we have in the past .
#Text=These images are going to remind the world that America can do big things .
#Text=And they ’ll remind the American people , especially our children , that there ’s nothing beyond our capacity — nothing beyond our capacity .
#Text=We can see possibilities no one has ever seen before .
#Text=We can go places no one has ever gone before .
#Text=You know , you ’ve — you ’ve heard me say it over and over again .
#Text=America is defined by one single word : possibilities .
#Text=Possibilities .
#Text=I want to thank the team at NASA for once again showing that that ’s who we are — that ’s who we are as a nation : a nation of possibilities .
#Text=And now let ’s take a look at the very first image from this miraculous telescope .
#Text=President envoys discuss School of Open Africa ’s groundbreaking vision
